H0.text: Which U.S. state was the first to legalize same-sex marriage, in 2004. California

H1.text: Which U.S. state was the first to legalize same-sex marriage, in 2004. New York

H2.text: Which U.S. state was the first to legalize same-sex marriage, in 2004. Vermont

H3.text: Which U.S. state was the first to legalize same-sex marriage, in 2004. Mass.

A4.text: The law went into effect on September 1, 2009, making Vermont the third U.S. state to legalize same-sex marriages, after Connecticut, Iowa and Massachusetts.

A5.text: It was the first state to legalize same-sex marriage in 2009, unforced by court challenge or ruling.

A6.text: On May 17, 2004, Massachusetts became the first U.S. state and the sixth jurisdiction in the world to legalize same-sex marriage following the Supreme Judicial Court's decision in Goodridge v. Department of Public Health six months earlier.
